channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees suffering from drought, 21st June
item.description:
The new trees on Sewdley St, E5 0AX and within the borough are NOT being watered during the hot spell and are therefore suffering from drought
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewdley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead and damaged trees in Sandringham Road, 21st June
item.description:
There is a dead tree outside No. 8 Sandringham Road. There are other trees further up the road which are severely damaged - possibly as a result of the drought a few years ago. One tree outside No. 14 has previously already been removed. While those cherry trees look nice when they are in bloom, they might not be most suitable for the area. We urgently need replacement / healthy trees in this street. The street is something of a heat collector, and the front gardens are too small to plant trees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandringham Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal A board ls - blocked pavements, 21st June
item.description:
Woolwich New Road is full of illegal A boards blocking the pavement The Council know and choose to ignore- why? Pavements also blocked by shops extending over pavement At the very least each A board needs a fine to the business owner as well.as the A board being removed and destroyed.

item.title: Abandoned bikes, 21st June
item.description:
Absolute disgrace five Forest bikes blocking the entire pavement. Four of the five bikes have fallen over. They are actually so far into the pavement that they are on the pedestrian crossing where the pavement has actually become texted to make blind people know that they are at the traffic lights this is an obstacle that literally no disabled person could get around this kind of bike is absolutely abysmal. Get rid of this ridiculous steam now it is auntie London auntie anybody who has any respect for another human being. I reported these bikes about three hours ago and they are actually in the worst state now than they were when they passed three hours ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 150, Stamford Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti all along Waterloo bridge, 21st June
item.description:
There is graffiti literally along the entire length of Waterloo Bridge the council by enabling graffiti to remain on the bridge for extended period of time. It’s just letting everybody know that they have no respect whatsoever for the area. This is the site but touristy of London it’s an absolute disgrace Get rid of the graffiti.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Theatre Avenue, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike middle of bridge bike lane, 21st June
item.description:
As is so characteristic of the kind of moron that hires a line bike one has actually been abandoned in the bike lane on Westminster Bridge the most selfish of selfish behaviour as anybody using such a bike could be they had absolutely no care for literally any other person on the planet these bikes need to be removed because all they do is enable this kind of selfish behaviour they didn’t exist. These morons couldn’t be so antisocial Get rid of these bikes now.!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strand, Holborn, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees dangerous, 21st June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutlej Road, Charlton, London
